CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C02

SHORT_DESCR.P: Gallagher has the sole appointment as insurance brokers to Denbighshire County Council (herein referred to as DCC) to prepare the Invitation to tender (ITT) document and access insurers via a OJEU Open tender exercise. This is in relation to the Council’s full insurance portfolio. This is due to the expiry of the Long term agreement (LTA) with their current insurers on 30.7.2018.

Bids from Insurance brokers via in house schemes or facilities (with the exception of Managing general agent or Managing general agent type organisations) are not required, with the exception of Gallagher as the Authority’s sole appointed broker. The Council is looking to award contracts to Insurance companies or their nominated exclusive agent.

Where a broker is acting as exclusive agent they must be able to evidence this by producing official documentation from the insurer which states this. Without that proof they cannot evidence their exclusivity.

TITLE.P: Property (including Computer, Business Interruption, Money, All Risks,

SHORT_DESCR.P: Gallagher has the sole appointment as insurance brokers to Denbighshire County Council (herein referred to as DCC) to prepare the Invitation to tender (ITT) document and access insurers via a OJEU Open tender exercise This is in relation to the Council’s full insurance portfolio. This is due to the expiry of the Long Term Agreement (LTA) with their current insurers on 30.7.2018.

Bids from Insurance brokers via in house schemes or facilities (with the exception of Managing general agent or Managing general agent type organisations) are not required, with the exception of Gallagher as the Authority’s sole appointed broker. The Council is looking to award contracts to Insurance companies or their nominated exclusive agent.

Where a broker is acting as exclusive agent they must be able to evidence this by producing official documentation from the insurer which states this. Without that proof they cannot evidence their exclusivity.
Tenders are invited for the whole insurance portfolio of DCC as fully detailed in this ITT document and the supporting documentation issued with it.
Contracts of insurance will be awarded on the basis of the most economically advantageous terms to DCC.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option to extend for 2 years and then another option to extend for 2 years so 3 + 2 + 2.

SUITABILITY.P: Bids are permitted from Insurance companies, Underwriting agencies and Managing general agents on behalf of Insurance companies. Bids are not permitted from Insurance brokers.
2.Reference to the relevant law, regulation or administrative provision

Bidders must be authorised by the FCA or EU equivalent to carry on business in the relevant classes of insurance as listed under this contract notice and be complying with any requirements set out by such authorisation.

REFERENCE_TO_LAW.P: Bids are permitted from Insurance companies, Underwriting agencies and Managing general agents on behalf of Insurance Companies. Bids are not permitted from Insurance brokers.
2.Reference to the relevant law, regulation or administrative provision

Bidders must be authorised by the FCA or EU equivalent to carry on business in the relevant classes of insurance as listed under this Contract Notice and be complying with any requirements set out by such authorisation.

INFO_ADD.P: Note: To register your interest in this notice and obtain any additional information please visit the Sell2Wales Web Site at https://www.sell2wales.gov.wales/Search/Search_Switch.aspx?ID=81451

Under the terms of this contract the successful supplier(s) will be required to deliver Community benefits in support of the Authority’s economic and social objectives. Accordingly, contract performance conditions may relate in particular to social and environmental considerations. The Community benefits included in this contract are:
DCC recognises that it has an implicit role in furthering sustainable local development through procurement of goods and services in the delivery of its responsibilities.
It’s further recognised the potential for positive socio-economic, community and environmental impacts across Denbighshire in developing a sustainable procurement philosophy.

Community benefit clauses are becoming commonplace in public sector contracts; DCC aims to ensure that, whenever appropriate, procured contracts shall include Community benefits clauses as an additional measure for determining Value for Money.

The Authority has produced a guidance document – included in the published ITT pack which is intended to assist those potential contractors and suppliers who may have little or no experience of delivering Community or Social benefit outcomes as part of a service contract.

It is important to note that your response should not provide generic corporate social responsibilities that you already undertake and should be relevant and proportionate to the lot you are bidding for. You should demonstrate how you will deliver your proposal on this contract, whilst providing clear evidence on how you will measure and report on the outcomes, at no extra cost.
Please provide a response for each lot you will be bidding for.
The buyer considers that this contract is suitable for consortia.
